page.title: 02LANDSCAPE AROUND COILACRIECH
page.content:
2. Forestry. Forestry accounts for nearly 50% of the land cover in the area and thus may be considered the most important land use. The majority of the land is owned by the Forestry Commission and is planted with Scots pine, Douglas Fir, Norway Spruce and Larch. Small areas of Scots pine trees are thought to be semi-natural.
3. Others Throughout the square there are scattered remains of the Birch woodlands which once covered the valley slopes more extensively. Sheep graze in some of these woodlands. 10% of the square is open moorland dominated by heather.
